author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1706870266}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review: Honestly: it's a fun but very frustrating game, the 1st level is the most enjoyable by far. With that being said i had fun playing it, however the lack of progression save does deduct a point. Additionally the boss level isn't really all that fun to play, mainly becuase of the frustrating controls/mechanics. It is a fun game non the less, though not worth the 3 bucks. Get it on sale, if at all, you ain't missing out on much, it's just another 2d platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1667409835}
review:
Crab Dub is an underwater adventure game developed by Anatoliy Loginovskikh and published by Sometimes You. The game is set deep down at the bottom of the ocean where Dr. Taco, the villain, has his dream of conquering the entire ocean. Together with his business partner, Mr. Rhino, they sponsor a project called "Crab Dub" which aims to create an army of Cyber-Crabs to help Dr. Taco fulfill his evil plan. However, the underwater inhabitants hire Blue Cassette Player to stop Dr. Taco and his companion. Mr. Rhino launches the first Cyber-Crab prototype to eliminate the Blue Cassette Player and anyone else who stands in Dr. Taco's way.

The game has clicker elements and a game palette that contains 20 primary colors. All objects in the game are animated and there are five types of weapons available including blaster, submachine gun, laser, shotgun, and bubble-gun. The game is divided into three zones: Ocean, Space, and Blender. The exclusive soundtrack adds to the game's overall charm.

Overall, Crab Dub is a fun game that offers an engaging storyline, a colorful and animated world, and a variety of weapons to choose from. The clicker elements of the game add an interesting twist to the gameplay. If you're a fan of adventure games set in an underwater world, then Crab Dub is definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349857022', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1670787972}
review:
[h1] Confusing and Frustrating [/h1]

Crab Dub is an absolute mess of a game. From the very beginning I knew I was in for a treat when I couldn't even figure out how to get into an actual level. There are actual steam guides on how to begin the game because it's just not obvious at all. This theme of having nothing explained to you carries throughout the whole game. There is no instruction on what you're supposed to do at all. In order to progress through parts of the game you have to find a cat to click on and then click on some weird medal thing. This isn't explained and it took me a solid 15 minutes to figure this out. I'd say a solid 50% of my already short play time was spent trying to figure out what the hell I was supposed to do in any given level. Then I'd say another 45% of my playtime was spent on the ATROCIOUS second level. Oh my god where do I begin with this absolute dog turd of a level. You're stuck in a tiny tube with an EXTREMELY slowly rising pool of acid that you must float in while clicking on falling cubes and rockets coming at you while also shooting said acid at falling apples to destroy them (again this wasn't made clear at all and I died 5 times before figuring out you can click the pool of acid to fire it at the falling apples. After probably 8 minutes of doing absolutely nothing, you finally get to the top to fight a boss. At this point you have rockets, apples, and cubes all coming at you with no reaction time at all to destroy them and the cubes sometimes get stuck behind clouds or falling acid so you can't destroy them and same with the apples. This creates a frustrating boss fight that isn't challenging because of interesting gameplay but instead because the developer put no care into their game at all. Finally we come to the final level which is just even more frustrating somehow. You're stuck doing these weird jumping sequences where you have to jump through space avoiding projectiles and stationary bombs. This isn't too bad EXCEPT FOR THE HITBOXES ARE SO WONKY AND JANK THAT YOU DIE WHEN YOU DON'T EVEN TOUCH ANYTHING. It's an absolute joke. It's like the developer forgot to finish the game. Actually that might be the case since there's not even a way to adjust the volume of the game. The music is actually surprisingly nice but what is not nice are the headache inducing sound affects every time you jump or shoot a gun, things that you will be doing a lot of. Just skip this piece of crap. It's not even worth the 50 cents I paid for it. For more reviews, follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40795588/] curator page. [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1655181658}
review:
Crab Dub is a 2D retro pixel platformer from Anatoliy Loginovskikh (more famous for the 100 hidden <object> puzzles).  This time instead we have some mutant crab thing and we have to traverse various puzzle levels by shooting and "activating" objects just by clicking on them.  Talk about immersion breaking. 

The game failed to garner any interest from gamers, by the developers own achievements.  The achievement for "activating the magic button" and clearing the first level has less than 5% of gamers holding it... 95% of people who own this game never bothered playing it to the end of the single screen tutorial first level.  Ouch. 

While the artwork is charming as always, it's badly presented here.  A choice was made to use obsolete retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or time, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.  Resolution is locked and can't be changed, and there's no visual or graphics tweaks, so there's no way to improve the compromised visuals.  

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for many differently-abled gamers.  There's no widescreen support, the game displays 4:3 pillarboxed (despite being launched in 2017!)  These flaws push this game far below minimum acceptable standards for PC. 

It's likely the 2D retro pixel look and compromised technical delivery was what deterred gamers, considering the developers modest success with the other, non-pixel games they've made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1613331140}
review:
This might have been OK for free, but it's not worth paying for. By the time you figure out the controls or where you need to go the game is over. 

Think I'm kidding? Here's the entire game done in 30 minutes:
https://youtu.be/sh9V59y0Td8
And half of that time is restarting due to random deaths. It took longer for the steam cards to drop than it did to finish the game.
---

author: {'steamid': '76561198043135631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2248, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1498754000}
review:
Crab Dub features mostly the positive reviews.
And the price of this game is somewhat cheap.
The game itself looks alright and sounds good.
But I just can't give Crab Dub a positive review.
My main issue is with the controls of this gem.
So: It would be a pretty good game otherwise.
But those annoying controls just make it meh.
It frequently feels so rage inducing and awful.
Especially the mouse aiming is just so clunky.
I'm gonna give a positive review to the music.
The soundtrack is in my opinion simply good.
But the base game will get a negative review.
Sorry, but those controls just really ruined it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 1730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1730, 'last_played': 1600594693}
review:
"Crab Dub" ist ein kleiner Plattformer.

Wir sind eine Wasserschnecke und mÃ¼ssen in farbintensiven Cartoon-Design drei Abschnitte meistern.

"Crab Dub" ist ein merkwÃ¼rdiges Spiel. Auf den ersten Blick wirkt es wie ein simpler Plattformer in ungewÃ¶hnlich stylischem Gewand. Blickt man unter die Haube findet man aber nur eine Sammlung aus drei Minispielen, alle sehr schwach gebaut und mit bescheuertem Leveldesign.

Der erste Levelabschnitt verwirrt schon dadurch, daÃŸ man gerade nicht das machen muÃŸ, was einem naheliegend erscheint. Man findet sich auf einer Plattform wieder und kann schieÃŸen, nachdem man sich schon im HauptmenÃ¼ die Waffe aussuchen konnte. Aber weder springen noch schieÃŸen fÃ¼hren weiter. Auch wenn das wie ein Spoiler wirkt, nenne ich hier die LÃ¶sung, weil sie ziemlich grottig ist: wir mÃ¼ssen nÃ¤mlich nur auf den Ausgang klicken und schon sind wir im nÃ¤chsten Abschnitt. 

Das ist aber kein gutes Leveldesign. NatÃ¼rlich kann man eine andere Struktur als die offensichtliche verwenden. DaÃŸ die LÃ¶sung aber die dummstmÃ¶gliche ist, spricht nicht gerade fÃ¼r das Spiel. Man fÃ¼hlt sich nicht etwa positiv Ã¼berrascht, sondern eher verarscht.

Und so etwas findet sich immer wieder. Im zweiten Level sind wir reitend auf einem, Quietscheentchen in einem Glaskolben und mÃ¼ssen Raketen, Quadraten und Ã„pfeln ausweichen oder sie zerstÃ¶ren, indem wir auf sie klicken. Mechanisch ist das ziemlich eindimensional und kratzt man einmal die bunte OberflÃ¤che ab, ist das einfach nur eine Clicker-Game-Variante. 

Dazu unpassend gibt es einen Dubstep-Soundtrack, also die Musikrichtung, die von KÃ¶nnen und Kompositionskompetenz am weitmÃ¶glichsten entfernt ist. Eine Richtung, die Bands wie "Little Big" wunderbar auf die Schippe nehmen, weil sie deren Monotie und Flachheit so auf die Spitze treiben, daÃŸ die Parodie eine eigene QualitÃ¤t bekommt. Hier aber ist von Satire nichts zu spÃ¼ren.

Umfangreich ist das Spiel auch nicht gerade. Und so fragt man sich stÃ¤ndig, ob die Macher nicht lieber einfach einen abgedrehten Comic herausbringen sollten, denn zeichnen kÃ¶nnen sie. Aber das Spieldesign sollten sie doch lieber Leuten Ã¼berlassen, die sich damit auskennen. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
2/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
4/10 Spielmechanik
2/10 Balancing
5/10 Spielspass 

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Schicker Schrott.

[h1][b]5/10 Gesamtwertung

review:
Review 2020:

The Game wasn't that much fun i only played it for the achievements... 

Well the game only costs 2,39â‚¬ but for an hour of gameplay that is okay. The game has different minigames and i think that makes the whole thing worse. I mean they aren't that bad but it feels like the developer made some minigames and put them in one game to sell it.

I wouldn't buy it but if you like some small minigames and a short game then buy it because there more games on steam that are worse than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1586784060}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] I played this game offline but I finished it in less than 2h.
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] Yes (1 achievement).
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] Yes (8 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] Yes (2 achievements).
[b]Developer Response:[/b] Never.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[i]Crab Dub[/i] is a mouse platformer game with different mechanics in each zones. There are 4 zones in total with a boss fight at the end of the zones.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The game uses 2D sprite graphics. I think it looks great for the price tag. I also find the level designs to be unique. I got a bit confused when I was going to play the first zone though so the design might be lacking on that part.

[h1]The game[/h1]
As I said before, the game has 4 zones with different mechanics. You can choose to tackle the first 3 zones in whichever order you want while the last one will be unlocked after you defeat the first three.

The first zone is a platformer game where you have to rescue any available little kittens in the area before proceeding to the exit. You can move and jump with your keyboard and do any other actions with your mouse. There are several areas that you have to finish before the boss and you have to redo the whole area if you die. You can double jump and bounce on jellyfishes to reach your destination. However, these jellyfishes will descend for a few meters after you bounce on it, making it difficult to reach the next platform if you're unable to reach it on the first try. I thought that the only way to finish the area is to bounce on the jellyfishes several times until I reach the exit before I realized in my second playthrough that I actually need to wait a bit before the jump. You also have a gun that can be changed to another type if you obtain a certain item. Note that all guns are available to select when you're about to tackle this zone so this might not be necessary. Anyway, these guns can be used to defeat some enemies, including the boss in this zone. There are also some enemies that are immune from your gun though. You also have 3 hearts that can be recovered if you click on any heart item that you encounter.

In my opinion, the second zone is the most unique zone. You'll be trapped in a tube and you have to click any ice cubes and rocket that you see, dodge all green thingies that comes from the top of the screen, and shoot any apples that also comes from the top of the screen. You'll also have 3 hearts in this zone and there are some heart items to replenish your heart after you reach certain points. Unlike other zones, this zone only has one area that will end after you defeat the boss at the top. It's very hard to beat though since the game needs you to click the objects in precise locations.

The third zone is more like the first one, except that you don't have your gun and have infinite jumps. The enemies are also different; you'll encounter a ball-like creature that can move if you click on it and meteor-like creature which will suddenly show up from the corner of the screen. There is a difficult area where you have to click the ball and avoid the meteors while jumping too. The boss in this stage is also tricky, although it's easy to beat.

The fourth zone only consists of a boss fight. The boss fight isn't that hard but can be annoying to beat.

Although the game has boss fights in all zones, you need to do different things in each zones in order to beat the boss. I admit the game might be a bit confusing at first and some people might also find it annoying to beat (especially the second zone), but it's kinda fun once you get the hang of it. The only thing that I don't like is the fact that you have to press escape after you die to continue.

Pros:
- 4 zones
- Each zone has different mechanics

Cons:
- Might be confusing at the start
- No auto reload after dying

[h1]Conclusions[/h1]
This is a mouse platformer game where you have to do different objectives in each zone. The game has 4 zones in total.

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you like a challenging platformer game that isn't too difficult, you can buy this game. It's a bit short though so buy it on discount if you feel like it's worth the price.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197974457154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1577477823}
review:
It's a nice platformer game. Nice music. It's NOT a game you can easily finish, it has a challenging gameplay.

The controls feel a bit strange and seems no way to change it. Sometimes you click something and nothing happens and you die. No tutorial, no progress saves possible, which can be annoying.

I would recommend it only for hardcare platform gamers or very cheap in sale to get the cards.
Because of the cons I cannot recommend this game for the 'general' gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086589981', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1561726204}

author: {'steamid': '76561198335475455', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1548885063}
review:
Crab Dub is a really peculiar... I guess I can call it a platformer, shooter, adventure game. You have 3 main stages you have to go through and once you complete them all, you unlock the final boss. 
The game is overall relatively easy to go through, but the first time you see it, you will most likely not understand anything that is happening.
SImple but also very enraging sometimes, Crab Dub has a nice look to it and can appeal to any casual player.
Recommended for its price.

+ Challanging gameplay

Cons :

author: {'steamid': '76561198158013558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1700842058}
review:
This game's great I have to say
it's really the dark souls of platformers. 
- It doesn't hold your hand at any point
- Bosses are hard
- Beloved by fans
- A wide variety of gameplay styles
- Only the best players have 100%ed it
- Amazing soundtrack
- Deep lore than no one really understands even though they pretend to
- Avid speedrunning community (look up Crab Dub at speedrun dot com if the link's inexplicably removed again https://www.speedrun.com/Crab_Dub )

Can't recommend enough
well worth the price

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1533375525}
review:
a Simple but nice little indie game we have here. Gives you that old arcade feeling look and if you are like me that grew up as they came out and at every nook and turn tried to get to one you would have nostalgia when games brings up those memories.

The game isn't very long unfortunately and will be beaten in two hours , it depends on the player, but each level is unique and different to the previous one. So we have a some variety here which makes the game kinda nice, adding to that arcade nostalgia i was talking about.
The graphics for the game is very decently done, the sounds and OST fits in well with the game and will be enjoyed.

Very decent game for it's price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009802063', 'num_games_owned': 2871, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1532816377}
review:
If there was a "mediocre" option, this game would get it.

Pros:
* It's very pretty
* The music is nice
* It's weird, and I like weird
* There are three little game zones (each a different play style)

Cons:
* The first zone contains the most content (2D platformer), and imo is the worst zone
* No gamepad option, no control remap
* Game uses a combination of keyboard (left, right, jump) and mouse (complete tasks, fire) which is really awkward
* The controls are A [left], D [right] and SPACE [jump] but direction+jump doesn't always seem to work, leading to lots of frustrating deaths.
* Space bar is an annoying key for [jump] because it automatically repeats, leading to accidental double-jumps.
* Complete lack of tutorial (i.e. "click on the blue-grey round thing to finish each level" woud have been useful). I usually do like exploring a game to work out how to play it, but this wasn't a fun way to do it.
* I think zone 2 would bore a lot of people. I'm from the Game + Watch generation, so this kind of simple, repetitive gameplay is alright, but even so - a few minutes in, it was getting boring.

Overall, the game has more negatives than positives, and that's mainly down to controls, so - it's a thumbs-down from me.

Also - if it's important to you, oh reader: I completed the game in 83 minutes with 100% achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312587074', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1528054229}
review: Crab dub es un juego de esos, para jugarlo en ciertos momentos, como cuando se descargan las actualizaciones de tu juego favorito, sin embargo, algo que es muy llamativo en este juego es su concepto, todo esta logrado bajo el concepto retro que recogen, desde su entorno grafico al sonoro. Es entretenido y vale jugarlo debes en cuando, incitan bastante a la competitividad a querer lograr mÃ¡s niveles.

review: Crab Dub is one of the greatest things I've ever had the privilege of experiencing. To start off the music made me cry with it's emotional beats and saddness. The gameplay is the greatest thing I've ever played. The controls are perfected in a way to make the experience for the player the best humanly possible. If you don't play this game you shouldn't consider yourself a gamer or someone with good taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1517430764}
review:
I really, honestly donâ€™t understand what compels some people to create the games they do. I understand games like Chaos Domain and A.R.E.S., games that have decent concepts botched horribly. Itâ€™s the ones like The Grandfather, where you can barely fathom why they exist at all. Crab Dub falls squarely into that category, a game whose story, art, gameplay, and entire concept are virtually impenetrable. Thereâ€™s nothing fun or entertaining about any part of this game, specifically because the choices involved in producing it appear to run entirely counter to any sort of logical game design.

Iâ€™m not going to waste time rephrasing the story, so you can have it straight from the store page: â€œDeep deep down at the bottom of the ocean is where the evil Dr. Taco reigns. His biggest dream is to conquer the entire ocean. Together with his business partner, Mr. Rhino, they sponsor a high-tech project called Â«Crab DubÂ».â€ You are apparently part of this project, sent out to stop â€œBlue Cassette Playerâ€ so that Dr. Taco can rule unimpeded. When you start the game it takes you to an undersea screen where you choose one of three episodes to play, and then you click the right arrow to proceed. That takes you to a platform with your sea-snail looking crab on a pillar, with a selection of guns to the right and Mr. Rhino at a desk to the left. You pick your weapon of choice and then click the pillar to launch off in a rocket.

The first level has you on a tiny platform suspended in the ocean. If you jump off, like towards the one other platform just out of reach, youâ€™ll plummet off the screen and end up in a void where your crab is sucking on a pacifier. The only way out is to hit Escape, restarting the level. It turns out what youâ€™re supposed to do is CLICK on the blue octagon in each level, sometimes after clicking on inflating cats. You might have to do some floaty platforming on jellyfish or avoid toast launched from toasters to get there, depending on the level. You can shoot things with your huge, beefy gun but the only enemies I saw were smug squids.

Does any of this make a lick of fucking sense to you? Because it doesnâ€™t to me, and I donâ€™t really get how anyone puts together crap like this and calls it fun. Lots of games do the keyboard movement / mouse aiming thing but not on tiny one-screen levels like this, often with no enemies. Thereâ€™s no indication what you should click on or what you should jump on or what you should shoot, leading to nothing but trial-and-error experimentation. The graphics have little stylistic distinction between solid objects, interactables, enemies, and background details. Nothing about this is good or interesting or well-designed, at all. I never expected to be so repulsed by such a modest, innocuous game, but I only spent 10 minutes playing it and Iâ€™m angry I wasted that much of my life.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

NOTICE:  These are my opinions about the experience I had playing this game.  I share them in hopes that people who are like minded will either enjoy a suggested game, or avoid frustration wasting time and money on something I felt was a personal waste.  Please feel free to comment positively, but know that anything that trolls or is just simply negative comments will be quickly deleted.  The reality is, that my reviews are for people who do not own the game, not to initiate philosophical dialogue about it.  If you are passionate about this game, please feel free to share that in your own review.  Funny nobody every trolls or bashes a positive review on steam ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198257966307', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1514109037}
review:
Nice little indie game but way too short..
This game is reminisent of arcad games ( die&retry ).

Each of the three levels offers a unique and different gameplay.
Level I is a platformer, in level II you try to fill a container and in level III you are on a space donkey !
You start the level and try to understand how to do things in order to progress in the game.

The ost and gaphics are good.
This game is sadly way way way too short.. But ! you can just replay it whenever you want.

Highly recommended, spent 100 hours on this game. Many laughs and aneurysms were had. One of the, if not THE greatest indie games I have ever played, and I have played 83% of all indie games. 5/7

author: {'steamid': '76561198280371208', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1509394521}
review:
[b] *Crab Noises followed by laser noises* [/b]

Crab Dub is about a lone crab going through three zones before fighting the very dangerous taco that you see on the zone select menu. Though, with a story obviously being apart of the game, instead of having random levels thrown in, nothing is really explained. Sure, there is a paragraph on the store page, but it is not given to us in any way in the game. So it just looks like a taco is weirdly placed on the level select screen and a rhino randomly smoking behind a desk when you do select a level.

So when you get into the game, you are met with three zones to select. Each having their own theme. The first zone will probably be the first one you play, and how confusing it is. Before you go into the game, you have to figure out how to actually get into it. Before you go into the first zone, specifically, you have a couple guns to choose from. Once you do that, there will be a button on the platform your crab is standing on, that when pushed, will let you start the level, instead of rather having a dedicated start button. 

This is when you realize, this is not just a platformer, but a mix between a platformer and a point and click. The game never tells you this, only telling you how to jump and move. With how the first level of the first zone looks, it certainly does not show this well as the platform that holds, from what the gameâ€™s achievements call it, a magic pill looks close enough to jump to it. Instead you just stay on the platform you started on and click it rather than trying to jump to it thinking the crab needs to pick it up. The next level does do better, with the new information that you need to click, this also shows that there are other objects you need to interact with before you can continue. The rest of the levels are designed as platformers, though there are two things that do come up in these levels. There is another object you need to activate before continuing, but it is not something you click, but something you need to stand on it. Next, there is no cooldown for taking damage. You can be on the same area as something that can hurt you for a small amount of time that it can kill you easily. With health being scarce in the first place, especially during the bosses, I donâ€™t see it as a problem. But as it is now, it only makes this game unfair. There is a double jump, but sometimes it just does not work, which can cause you to die.

The second zone puts you on a rubber duck and dumps you into a cylinder with green liquid. Again, only telling you how to move, but having elements where you have to click objects to survive. Missiles coming in from the side need to be detonated before getting to you, no matter if the cylinder should be cracked before it gets to you, while light blue blocks will keep floating in the liquid if you donâ€™t click on it. Lastly, there is an apple that will bounce off of the cylinderâ€™s walls. Clicking it does nothing, and you will always be hit by it. So how can you make the apple disappear? By clicking the liquid you are floating on to hit the apple, which in turn will lower the liquid level till more is added periodically. The only thing this is missing other than a proper tutorial is checkpoints.

The third, and last, zone is in space. The crab on a dog which can jump infinitely, but be sure to not go past the sparkling border or you will die. This is basically the same as first zone as you need to click on the magic pill to continue. Unless there are other objects you need to click before clicking the magic pill to continue. With pink balls, one that you can click to move and one you canâ€™t that keeps soaring past the screen, will hurt you.

Before each zone ends is a boss. The boss being the same boombox throughout each zone. Depending on the zone you are in, the method to defeating them is different. After depleting the boombox health to 0, a very...weird sequence happens with a gullotine.

With the Boss zone dealing with the taco that you see the whole time. Taking place in space, with a gun in your crabby claws, the boombox constantly going after you, the taco occasionally sending out a circle of bullets, and the pink balls sailing through space threatening you. But having one thing that is different, and does not communicate well. You shoot the magic pill instead of clicking it to continue on to the ending â€œTo Be Continuedâ€ ending screen. 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Crab Dub is certainly not the worst out there, but that certainly is not a qualifier for telling if a game is good or not. Perhaps if this was handled more rather than stopping at putting in three different levels, Crab Dub could have been better. If more care was put into making this more enjoyable, putting in more than one music track, and an implementation of the story and how to play other than how to move. In contrast, the visuals are pleasing to the eye that it would still hold up if everything else was improved on. If you are an achievement hunter, then you will find this your kind of game to gather more achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031654661', 'num_games_owned': 3513, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1504691101}
review:
Crab Dub is a 2D platformer with 3 different zones that all have a boss at the end. It's not very long and unfortunately it's not very good either.

Zone 1 lets you choose a weapon before you start - once you do, you play a bunch of levels where your goal is to click the object at the end. You can click on some other objects like hearts/bubbles and sometimes you need to click on another object before you can finish. These levels are decent but the controls aren't that great - you need to be clicking in the middle of an object for it to count and the double jump can feel unresponsive.

The second zone was my favourite as it plays more like a shooter. You have to survive in a tube that slowly fills up and click blocks and missiles before they hit you. You can also click on the liquids to shoot apples, but this makes the liquid go down a little so you have to aim well. This zone is challenging but fair most of the time and the only thing that makes it annoying is there are no checkpoints.

Zone 3 is the same as Zone 1 but it's in space so you can jump infinitely and there are no weapons. Hooray? The game then just ends on a weird boss fight and it's over with a "to be continued..."

Crab Dub definitely isn't the worst thing i've played but it's not that fun either. The presentation is mediocre, especially with the music being random and repeating on new levels/deaths. There are definitely some interesting ideas here but I wouldn't really waste your time - maybe the sequel will be better?

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1503013939}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]A quirky three-level skool-daze (you either get it or you don't, don't ask..) platform-floater-shooter! I did say it's quirky.. The graphics are 8bit, the music (a bit repetitive for my taste but I've listened to much worse) is..dubby(!) and the gameplay is that hard-ish kind of type, but oddly in a good way! Others say it's tough but I found it just demanding as you have to pay attention to what is happening and [b]there is one save slot[/b] not "no saves" as I've read elsewhere. Well I had fun but belongs in the 1â‚¬ category or in a bundle and it's quite short so..

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988951570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1668447451}
review:
Fails to implement basic mechanics from platformers:
- Double jump randomly decides to not work, killing you in the process.
- Progress for beating levels is not saved, and is even reset by exploring menues without even closing the game.
- There is no explanation at all of objectives or controls, even the main menu is confusing since the whole game is designed to be abstract.
- No cooldown period for damage by the same enemy. A single toast hit can take all of your 3 hearts.

review:
Lagging controls, especial for the mouse.
Double jumps work sometimes, not when needed most, which is very frustrating.
Three levels, quite difficult. The game seems to love it to crash when you reach the last stage of level one.
+ Checkpoints while in the game
-  Progress will be lost if you exit the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198352666532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1494028525}
review:
[h1]If you plan on buying this game don't. Here's why:[h1]

Cons:
 -No proper tutorial when you start. 
   ~When I first started this game, I wasn't sure what to do at the stage screen, but after simply clicking on the character I was in the level.(This game has 3 Stages)
-No story telling.
 ~You just clear levels, until you get to the final one in that Stage.(That's it)

Pros:
-Gets challenging after a few levels in that certain stage.
-Runs well on pretty much anything.
-Somewhat good controls.
-No 'lives' system
 ~just press esc key when you die to respawn.
-Has steam cards you can Idle/play for.
-Achievements that are somewhat simpl to complete.

Overall, not very entertaining to play, for me at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966248684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1494362741}
review:
I rarely write reviews, but this game is something "special".
Gameplay: SuperMario was a way better, but SuperMario is 30+ years older than this ...
Musik: Thank God, Windows 7 allows to disable any applications musik
There are no options and !!! no saves, if you want to meet the final boss you have to beat zones 1-3 in a row, once you quit the game your progress will be reseted. There are no "easy achievements" - you have to complete this game in one session. It doesn't worth 2,99â‚¬, this "game" is just trash

review:
The hardest part is figuring out what to do.  The game isn't that difficult after figuring out all the controls.

Still, it's short (45 minutes to an hour) and a bit clunky.  The achievements are easy if you care about that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009596311', 'num_games_owned': 5864, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1493955743}
review:
The game's biggest flaw is the lack of instructions on how to play. You're given the controls to move, but have to figure out things like clicking on the cats in zone 1 to activate the magic rune that teleports you to the next room. It's a mixed bag because once you learn the gimmicks, it doesn't take long to beat the game. I 100% the game in 40 minutes and it blew by thanks to the groove-tastic soundtrack.

Sadly for the price to play ratio and there not being much reason to replay the game after completion, I feel the price isn't worth it at $3, but is very much worth it for listening to the soundtrack and the well animated sprites.

Overall score: 6/10 Massive downscore due to lack of content, but it was very fun while I played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145457499', 'num_games_owned': 2683, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1494270427}
review: It's decent but pretty short. I finished it with all the achievements in about an hour. I wouldn't pay 3 dollars for this; I got it at DailyIndieGame as a part of a bundle. So if it is on sale, take a look at it. It has some creative elements and the music is catchy enough. Some of the level design is somewhat flawed making it easy to get around obstacles and quickly beat levels. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038056805', 'num_games_owned': 3183, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1492385981}
review:
This game is [b]not[/b] an easy completionist game. I was on astats trying to find some easy completionist games that I owned, this was what came up further down on the list.

It's a semi-difficult platformer/mouse shooter hybrid that stays pretty nice to it's genre. All three stages are different in their own way, and a lack of tutorial options or even a general idea of what to do next makes the game significantly more difficult as you die a few times trying to figure out what to do.

Crab Dub is a nice game for the price, it has some imaginative points and some difficult pieces. I really enjoyed that the first level was one of the most difficult, yet it forced you to learn perfect timing for your double jump so you wouldn't have (as much) trouble going into later levels.

Overall, I recommend this to anyone looking for a challenge from the ez pz completionist grind. Not an easy 100%, but a quick one if you catch on early enough.

review: Deep deep down at the bottom of the ocean is where the evil Dr. Taco reigns. His biggest dream is to conquer the entire ocean. Together with his business partner, Mr. Rhino, they sponsor a high-tech project called Â«Crab DubÂ». The projectâ€™s ultimate goal is to create an army of Cyber-Crabs that would faithfully serve Dr. Taco and help him to fulfill his evil plan. However, the underwater inhabitants very soon discover about this project. They hire Cats-Killers to stop Dr. Taco and his companion. Mr. Rhino decides not to wait for the Â«Crab DubÂ» project to be completed and launches the first Cyber-Crab prototype. Itâ€™s mission is to eliminate the Cats and anyone else who stands in Dr. Tacoâ€™s way. At some point the Cyber-Crabâ€™s microchips have a glitch and he realizes that he is fighting for the evil side. What would be more important to you? To faithfully serve your creator? Or to betray him and join the good side? Itâ€™s up to you to decideâ€¦

author: {'steamid': '76561198043364750', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1484969168}
review: I hate that this is my first review, but Crab Dub is not a very good game.  It is comprised of three mini-games, and none of them make any sense.  One gives me a gun that I can't seem to shoot anything with.  The next expects me to jump up to an unknown destination, but then I die when I get out of bounds.  The final one at least lets me blow stuff up, but I just sit at the bottom of a tube and never get anywhere.  There are no instructions to explain what is expected of you, the controls are unfriendly at best (A and D to move, space to jump and the mouse to shoot?) and not very conducive to a game that can require precise movement.  They aren't even configurable.  I give the other two folks that posted reviews credit for spending multiple hours with this game, because after a couple of minutes I was ready to delete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575550', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 625, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1484748456}
review:
Too frustrating for no reason and too disjointed to make any sense. Seems like 3 mini-games that happen to share art. Plenty of games do that and are still popular so where this one really fails is just simple game design. The first level isn't an introduction! If your game is going to be this strange the player needs a little help to start. It's a shame really because it feels like there is talent here.

I made a video:
https://youtu.be/1NSKFMTSYbQ
